headline.main: Missouri Family Renews Battle Over Right to Die

byline.original: By ANDREW H. MALCOLM, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Four months after the United States Supreme Court issued its first ruling in a right-to-die case, the family of the victim returned to their county courthouse today in a renewed legal battle to let their daughter die. The daughter, Nancy Beth Cruzan, is 32 years old now and remains in a persistent vegetative state in a state hospital near here, the comatose victim of an automobile accident in 1983. She never regained consciousness, and has survived only because of chemical nutrition and medicines pumped into her stomach through a surgically implanted tube. Removal of the tube would result in death in a few days.
